descriptions.content:
This verb, which means “to want,” requires the main verb to be in the present-future.

It appears only as a modal verb (and not as a main verb), and may be combined with the following auxiliaries. It functions in a similar way to the verb དགོས་ “need.”

  • in the present: འདོད་ཡོད་ (egophoric), འདོད་འདུག་, or འདོད་ཡོད་རེད་
  • in the past: འདོད་བྱུང་ (egophoric), འདོད་བྱུང་སོང་, or འདོད་བྱུང་བ་རེད་
  • in the future: འདོད་ཀྱི་རེད་

The perfective past auxiliaries སོང་, པ་རེད་, and བཞག་ may not directly follow the verb འདོད་. The following constructions are thus wrong: *འདོད་སོང་ *འདོད་པ་རེད་ *འདོད་བཞག་. These example sentences are correct:

  • ང་གངས་ཏི་སེར་འགྲོ་འདོད་ཡོད། “I want to go to Kailash.”
  • ཁྱེད་རང་ཚོ་བོད་ལ་ཕེབས་འདོད་ཡོད་པས། “Would you like to go to Tibet?”
